Class ec.identity.name.IdentityName 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.identity.name.IdentityName
public class IdentityName
extends Object
implements Serializable
An identity name is a user readable way of identifying an identity. It consists of two parts. One is the "handle"; a string name, chosen by the identity corresponding to the IdentityName. The second is a string "nick name", chosen by the local user to refer to the IdentityName identity. The local user ensures that the "nick name" is unique, i.e. it never gives the same nick name to more than one identity.

Identity name equality checking is done on the basis of the nick name (after lower casing) ONLY.

IdentityName objects are immutable (modulo some internal caching) so they can be freely handed around and shared between different threads.

See Also:
Identity

IdentityName 
 public IdentityName(String nickName,
                     String handle)
Constructor for identity name when we have a nick name for the identity

Parameters:
nickName - - nick name, must be non null and must be a valid name
handle - - handle, must not be null and must be a valid name
Throws: IllegalArgumentException
if handle or nickName is null or invalid

Throws: IllegalArgumentException
if handle is null or invalid or if identity is null

hasNormalizedWhitespace 
 public static boolean hasNormalizedWhitespace(String name)
Check if the given name has normalized whitespace e.g. contains no control or whitespace characters apart from SPACE and contains no double spaces.

isValid 
 public static boolean isValid(String name)
Checks if the given name is a valid identity name i.e. is not null or the null string, doesn't look like a nick name (i.e. does not contain a { followed by a }), and has normalized spacing. Note that only matched pairs of handle parentheses - { followed by } - are illegal; unmatched handle parentheses are ok.

Returns:
true if name is valid, false otherwise
checkName 
 public static String checkName(String name)
Checks if the given name is a valid identity name i.e. is not null or the null string, doesn't look like a nick name (i.e. does not contain a { followed by a }), and has normalized spacing. Note that only matched pairs of handle parentheses - { followed by } - are illegal; unmatched handle parentheses are ok.

Returns:
one of the string constants declared in this class e.g. NAME_VALID, NAME_TOO_LONG etc.
normalizeWhitespace 
 public static String normalizeWhitespace(String name)
Normalize the whitespace in the given name i.e. ensure that the only control or whitespace character is SPACE, trim any leading or trailing whitespace, and collapse any multiple spaces into a single space.

makeValid 
 public static String makeValid(String name)
Make name valid, by normalizing whitespace and exchanging any handle like parentheses for normal parentheses. Note that this method only gets rid of matched sets of "handle parentheses"; any unmatched ones are left alone.

concatNickNameAndHandle 
 public static String concatNickNameAndHandle(String nickName,
                                              String handle)
Concatenate the given handle and nick name in standard format i.e. so they look like "nick name {handle}". In the case where the handle and the nick name are equal (when lower cased), returns just "nick name". Note that the resulting string is NOT necessarily a valid name itself, but it will return true if tested with 'hasNormalizedWhitespace'. It's a fatal error (IllegalArgumentException) if either 'handle' or 'nickName' is not a valid name

getNickName 
 public String getNickName()
Accessor for nick name

getLowerCaseNickName 
 public String getLowerCaseNickName()
Accessor for nick name, in lower case (useful for comparison)

getHandle 
 public String getHandle()
Accessor for handle

getFullName 
 public String getFullName()
Construct the full name of this identity, by building string containing the name and nick name, in standard format "nick name {handle}" e.g. "Freddy Boy {Fred}".

If the name and nick name are the same then just "nick name" is returned, rather than "name {name}" e.g. "Fred" rather than "Fred {Fred}"

getLowerCaseFullName 
 public String getLowerCaseFullName()
Get the full name, as returned by 'getFullName', but return it all forced to lower case

equals 
 public boolean equals(Object other)
Equality checking. Because nick names must be locally unique, this just compares nick names, using case insensitive matching
